description: Nami creates a Cool Ball on the ball end of her Perfect Clima-Tact, which allows her to manipulate temperature and perform upgraded versions of her weather techniques. This is a preparatory move that sets up more advanced attacks.

keyMoments.description: Nami first uses Cool Charge against Kalifa, setting up her Mirage Tempo: Fata Morgana technique.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of this preparatory technique that enhances Nami's meteorological abilities.

abilityNameJapanese: 蜃気楼=ミラージュ・テンポ ファタ・モルガナ
description: An advanced version of Mirage Tempo that creates five visual illusions of Nami using reflections and refractions within the air. The images consist of a long and tall skinny version, a short kid version, a fat version, a big muscular version, and a normal version of Nami. All images move in perfect unison with the real Nami, and any attack she produces is replicated, creating a barrage of projectiles with only one-fifth being real. Named after the complex mirage phenomenon 'Fata Morgana', which is associated with Morgan le Fay from Arthurian legend.

keyMoments.description: Nami debuts this spectacular technique against Kalifa, creating five mirage versions of herself that completely confuse her opponent.
keyMoments.significance: One of Nami's most iconic and visually impressive techniques, demonstrating her mastery of meteorological phenomena and creative combat application.

description: A variation of the Rokushiki technique Shigan (Finger Gun) that Kalifa developed. Instead of a straight finger thrust, she uses a flexible, whip-like motion to extend her finger strike's range and make it curve, allowing her to attack from unexpected angles.

keyMoments.description: Kalifa demonstrates this Shigan variation during her battle with Nami, showcasing her adaptation of the standard Rokushiki technique.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Kalifa's mastery and personalization of CP9's martial arts techniques.

description: A defensive technique used by Zoro and Sogeking together to deflect simultaneous attacks from Kaku and Jabra. The technique demonstrates their improvised teamwork despite their contrasting fighting styles.

keyMoments.description: Zoro and Sogeking use Makie to defend against coordinated attacks from two CP9 agents.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the Straw Hats' ability to coordinate and adapt to team-based combat situations.
